This garden of eden beautiful dining experience nestled amongst trees, flowers and tranquility, the moment you step foot inside Dinner at Cim's you are transported to a magical kingdom of tantalizing tastes, exceptional beauty of extravagance in which this home garden restaurant has the perfect balance of old and new, amazing ambiance, delightful soft soothing jazz, classical or easy listening tunes playing in the background and a colorful setting throughout. Chef connoisseur extraordinaire Cim and his exemplary culinary kitchen staff serve up delicious dishes with a distinguishable difference and a unique customized quality that's simply not present in big city restaurants, with added flavor and flair of Nordic, Mediterranean and South East Asian influences, adding to the culture and character that a small village like Nha Trang offers. Whatever your taste buds desires this elegant cute and cozy cottage like restaurant has all the ingredients to create an amazing culinary experience no matter the occasion whether you with friends, family, couple or on your own this place is ideal to share with love, laughter and connections alike. The wine sommelier will also provide the perfect wine pairing whether you go for fresh fish, ocean seafoods, delicious juicy meats,  aromatic vegetarian or world class cheeses cuisine it's a sensational engaging atmosphere of delight from start to finish

(Äá»‘i vá»›i nhá»¯ng mÃ³n Äƒn cÃ³ thá»ƒ so sÃ¡nh Ä‘Æ°á»£c vÃ  khung cáº£nh thá»±c sá»± lÃ£ng máº¡n vÃ  nhá»¯ng ngÆ°á»i phá»¥c vá»¥ khÃ´ng trÃ² chuyá»‡n, Ä‘á»ƒ báº¡n yÃªn tÃ¢m trÃ² chuyá»‡n vÃ  Äƒn uá»‘ng vá»›i ngÆ°á»i báº¡n Ä‘á»“ng hÃ nh cá»§a mÃ¬nh, nhÃ  hÃ ng PhÃ¡p á»Ÿ phÃ­a Báº¯c lÃ  lá»±a chá»n tá»‘t hÆ¡n nhiá»u vÃ¬ há» cung cáº¥p nhiá»u loáº¡i rÆ°á»£u hÆ¡n vá»›i nhiá»u má»©c giÃ¡ VÃ€ láº¥y tháº» tÃ­n dá»¥ng.)..(BÃ i Ä‘Ã¡nh giÃ¡ gá»‘c).Food and restaurant setting were good.  So why 3 stars?..We went to celebrate our anniversary. However, we were not expecting a VERY chatty precocious young boy as our waiter who was at our table chatting away the entire night. He is very sweet but extremely chatty, so we were rarely left alone...For Nha Trang,  it is considered on the higher end and most of their wines are in the 2 million range and more--- but they take no credit cards! So a meal for two could easily cost 3 or 4 million but no credit cards!..And at that level of price, which is considered high for Vietnam and certainly Nha Trang, one would expect a much higher level of service ( not an extremely chatty kid) and credit cards...And it is not as if there are no good wines at a lower price point which could still be marked up sufficiently to give the restaurant a high profit...Having talked to many people in Nha Trang about our experience, apparently the two observations are fairly common...On another review,  the owner commented in response, essentially that they are "just" a family restaurant.  That may be, but the prices do not match a "family" restaurant...At a lower price point one befitting a "family" restaurant, one would have a much lower expectation as to service, that it is  not "romantic", not worthy of a special occasion, and that  the wines offered  would be reasonable, compared to other " family " restaurants...So go because the food is good ( excellent mashed potatoes, for example) but really, really lower your expectations drastically,  and do bring at least 3 plus million Dong in CASH, if you want to drink only one bottle (and at least 5 million if you like a white and a red). Or bring your own wine and see what the corkage fee, if any, is. (For comparable food, and a truly romantic setting and non-chatty servers who leave you alone to talk and eat with your companion, the French restaurant on the North is a much better option as they offer a bigger selection of wine at many price points AND take credit cards. )

The quality was absolutely outstanding to an extent that makes it unfair. The gentleman behind this restaurant was simply cooking up food he can hang his chefs hat on in a pair of board shorts and a t-shirt, while his delightful son wowed us with his opinion on his latest Tom Clancy novel. The garden atmosphere is intimate and familiar with perfect ambiance for a date, an anniversary or a quiet meal with friends. The portions are healthy, but do not be fooled by the 'taste of everything' because it is a menu designed for 2. Myself and a friend saw it more as a 5 courser for 1. We were mistaken as we somehow managed to plow through a sweet gorgonzola like goat cheese salad, lobster soup with home made cured salmon, spicy prawn platter, authentic carbonara, a 5oz strip loin with roasted garlic peppery mash, and a perfect apple crumble a la mode. We were silly enough to have also ordered the swedish meatballs with lingonberry and a baked camembert. We could not let it go. Excellent wine list, superbly friendly service to where I questioned whether everyone was family. This restaurant is not an "option" if you are in town.
